text:
Is it possible to add the GraphiQL Explorer to a portal even though they don't have Sales Hub Enterprise or Service Hub Enterprise?

Since CRM Development Tab is part of those products, but GraphQL is available with CMS Pro, it doesn't make sense to nest the explorer under the CRM Development Tab.

I'm working on a project for a customer where we need to use GraphQL and using without the explorer is quite a challenge (especially for custom objects associations). The thing is this customer have CMS Pro but doesn't have Sales Hub Enterprise or Service Hub Enterprise so I can't activate the beta to have the CRM Development Tab.

Can we have the explorer in another way?
the documentation shows it is available for CMS Hub Pro and Enterprise, could you try forcing the URL by copying the structure from an enterprise account to see if you can get to the tool directly?
Can you go to this url? <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/graphiql> if you can't go to this url that means your account doesn't have graphql support
Thanks for the direct link Carter, I tested on a CMS Pro subscription and it works :raised_hands::skin-tone-2:
Of course, I just learned that direct link trick from <@U03FJQPSC0Y> super nice trick
